newsitem.title: USA: Kimberly-Clark sees $600 mln sale proceeds. [CORRECTED 18:51 GMT]
newsitem.headline: Kimberly-Clark sees $600 mln sale proceeds. [CORRECTED 18:51 GMT]

text.p: Kimberly-Clark Corp said on Tuesday that it was looking for a buyer for Toronto-based Scott Paper Ltd, and that it expected $600 million in proceeds from the divestitures in 1996. (Corrects from "proceeds from the sale in 1996" to make clear that $600 million not just from Scott sale.)
Kimberly-Clark said on April 18 it planned to sell its 50.1 percent stake in Scott Paper, and Scott said its advisors were seeking a buyer for 100 percent of the company.
Chief Financial Officer Jack Donehower told a conference call, "While we cannot reveal full details, the process is works to find a buyer for the whole company."
He said the $600 million in proceeds Kimberly-Clark would receive from divestitures (corrects from "the sale") contributed to the company's strong 1996 cash flow position.
